availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob D. Gossett (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Clark County, Kentucky, native. Married to Joan F. Ratliff Gossett on September 2, 1846. Father of Caleb Sanford Gossett, Matthias Gossett, Ann E. Gossett, Mary E. Gossett, Martin R. Gossett, Alfred N. Gossett, Emma L. Gossett, and Edward B. Gossett. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Bath County 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p.112B.

Elder Jacob Dunham Gossett (1818-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial 51787796, accessed July 8, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/51787796.
